title: How to Draw Curved Lines in Photoshop

steps.headline: Open your Photoshop project.
steps.description: If you haven't already done so, double-click the project in which you want to create a curved line to open the project.

steps.headline: Select the Pen tool.
steps.description: Select the Pen icon, which resembles a fountain pen nib. It's in the toolbar to the left. The Pen Tool is not available in Photoshop Elements.

steps.headline: Position your cursor.
steps.description: Before you begin drawing, place your cursor over the point at which you want to begin your drawing.

steps.headline: Click and hold where you want the line to start.
steps.description: This will create the first anchor point for your line.

steps.headline: Drag in the direction you want the line to arch.
steps.description: This creates curve data for the line. The point at which you release the cursor is the point where the apex of your curved line will reach.

steps.headline: Click and hold the point where you want the line to connect.
steps.description: This will create a line from the first anchor point to the second anchor point you just created.

steps.headline: Drag the mouse in the opposite direction of the curve.
steps.description: You will see the line curve adjust as you drag the mouse cursor. Release your mouse cursor when the line curve is to your liking.

steps.headline: Add more anchor points.
steps.description: You can add curves to your existing line by clicking and holding the next point of the line and then dragging your mouse to set the curve of the segment. Try to get your line to loop back to the starting anchor point so you can close the line section and create a shape.

steps.headline: Click the starting anchor point.
steps.description: Once you've created a line to your liking, you can prevent the Pen tool from creating additional curves by hovering your cursor over the hollow initial line point and then clicking it once you see the small circle appear next to the cursor.

steps.headline: Use the Direct Select tool to adjust points and curves.
steps.description:
The Direct Select tool is the icon that resembles a white arrow. Click it in the toolbar and use it to adjust your line using the following steps:
Click a line to see all the points on the lines. Then click and drag a point to move it. When you click a point using the Direct Select tool, you will see two lines with dots on the end extend from the point in opposite directions. These are the bezier curve handles. Click and drag the dots on these handles to adjust the curve.

steps.headline: Add or delete anchor points.
steps.description:
After you create a curved line, you can adjust the detail by adding or deleting points within the line. Use the following steps to add or delete points in a line:
Click and hold the Pen tool icon in the toolbar to display a pop-out menu. Click the Add Anchor Point tool, or Delete Anchor Point tool in the Pen Tool pop-out menu. Click an Anchor point with the Delete Anchor Point tool to delete the anchor point. Click a spot on the line with the Add Anchor Point tool to add a new anchor point.

steps.headline: Open your Photoshop project.
steps.description: If you haven't already done so, double-click the project in which you want to create a curved line to open the project.

steps.headline: Click and hold the Pen Tool.
steps.description: It's in the toolbar to the left. This displays a pop-out menu next to the Pen Tool icon.

steps.headline: Click the Curvature Pen tool.
steps.description: It's in the Pen Tool submenu in the toolbar to the left. The Curvature Pen tool is not available in Photoshop Elements or older versions of Photoshop.

steps.headline: Click the first point of your line.
steps.description: This creates the first anchor point.

steps.headline: Click the second point.
steps.description: This will create a straight line between your first anchor point and your second anchor point.

steps.headline: Click a third point.
steps.description: Doing so creates a line that curves through all three anchor points. The Curvature Pen tool allows you to draw a curve simply by clicking different points in succession.

steps.headline: Add more points.
steps.description: You can continue adding points by clicking the places on the canvas on which you want to illustrate your line. The line will automatically curve to fit the points.

steps.headline: Click the starting anchor point.
steps.description: This completes the curve shape. Click the line to create an additional anchor point. Click and drag an anchor point to adjust the shape of the curve. Click an anchor point and press Delete to remove it.
